meanings.sent1: The noodle was the limpest thing I ever held.
meanings.sent2: The flower petals were the limpest I had seen, wilting in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The limpest handshake I received was from a sleepy kitten.
meanings.sent4: Her resolve was as limpest as a wet paper towel, easily torn.
meanings.sent5: The limpest balloon barely floated above the ground, ready to fall.

meanings.sent1: The limpest tree in the forest looked ready to fall over.
meanings.sent2: After being sick for days, she felt the limpest she had ever felt.
meanings.sent3: His limpest attempt at lifting the heavy box made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The limpest battery could not power even a small toy.
meanings.sent5: The limpest flame flickered weakly, struggling to stay lit.

meanings.sent1: The limpest cheer from the crowd barely reached the players.
meanings.sent2: Feeling tired, she gave the limpest smile to her friend.
meanings.sent3: His limpest dance moves made the party more amusing than ever.
meanings.sent4: The limpest song on the radio failed to lift anyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The limpest joke fell flat, receiving only a polite chuckle.
